oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SEDIMENTATION STUDIES ON THE NIGER RIVER DELTA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mayor-Mora, Ramiro
Mortensen, Preben
Fredsoe, Jorgen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sedimentation
Niger River
river delta
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An area of the Niger River Delta was studied from October 1974 to October 1975 in connection with feasibility studies and preliminary design for the development of a deep draught port in the Western portion of the Delta. The provision of a"100-kilometer, 8 or 10 m navigation channel through one of the entrances from the sea, up to new port facilities at Warri required comprehensive hydraulic, hydrographic and sedimentation surveys over such period.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 15 (1976): Proceedings of 15th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Honolulu, Hawaii, 1976.; 125
